title: 'Let her speak!': Protests erupt after Montana Republicans silence trans lawmaker in gender debate
description: Lawmakers voted Monday to continue denying Democratic state Representative Zooey Zephyr the chance to speak on a proposal that would have restricted when children could change the names and pronouns they go by in schools. Protests forced legislative leaders to pause proceedings and clear the room.

title: 'The first 'banking panic of the Twitter era' materialized as the Silicon Valley Bank collapsed'
description: The rapid spread of information on social media and digital money withdrawals accelerate the risks of a banking panic, Eric Albert writes in his column.

title: US says Sudan rivals agree to ceasefire after hundreds killed
description: The US secretary of state said Monday that the rival generals in Sudan have agreed to extend a shaky cease-fire for another three days as foreign nations continue evacuating their nationals.

title: Pakistani police say 2 blasts at counterterrorism facility kill at least 12
description: No one immediately claimed responsibility for the attack that occurred on Monday in northwest Pakistan, but the Pakistani Taliban have claimed similar attacks since ending a cease-fire with the government last year.

title: Russia: Man sentenced to seven years in prison for 'denying Nazi character of Ukrainian regime'
description: Police captain Semiel Vedel was wiretapped by his own colleagues. His conviction is the first for spreading 'false information' about the Russian army.

title: British government asks court to block nurse strike
description: Nurses are set to strike again for three days after members of a union voted to reject a 5% increase in their wages.

title: Cannes Festival adds 'Le Retour' to line-up despite on-set controversy
description: Reports have been made of inappropriate behavior, including the use of a child in a sex scene and verbal abuse from the director Catherine Corsini.

title: Mayotte: Ahead of 'Wuambushu' operation, French riot police used hundreds of grenades
description: CRS riot police, during clashes in the archipelago in the Indian Ocean on Sunday, used tear gas and sting-ball grenades. They also fired live ammunition 'towards the ground and to scare away'.

title: CNN host Don Lemon says news channel has fired him
description: The presenter is leaving the news channel he has long worked for, two months after controversial remarks about Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley.

title: Geopolitical tensions are a new obstacle to restructuring the debt of poor countries
description: China has become the largest creditor for low-income countries. Finding agreements to reduce the debts of nations in severe difficulty requires a consensus among creditors – but they all have different strategies.

title: Tucker Carlson leaves Fox News, where he fueled controversies as star host
description: Days after the American news network settled a giant lawsuit over incorrect reporting on 2020 election fraud, it announced it was parting ways with its most famous presenter.

title: Sudan: France closes embassy in Khartoum until further notice
description: Like several countries, France rushed to evacuate its citizens and those of other countries.

title: Shaken Baby Syndrome article retracted over ethics
description: A study on head injuries related to Shaken Baby Syndrome has been withdrawn by a journal as the writers did not have authorization to use healthcare data for research.

title: 'The poorest European countries are sliding into a war economy'
description: Since Russia's unilateral annexation of Crimea in 2014, Eastern Europe has been rearming, particularly Poland. But the development of a powerful military industry might affect other sectors, such as the ecological transition, health and education.

title: Conviction for 1980s Paris synagogue bombing ends one of France's longest judicial cases
description: A French court sentenced Hassan Diab, a Lebanese-Canadian citizen, to life in prison. He lives in Canada and was tried in absentia.

title: Comoros refuses Mayotte migrant boats permission to dock
description: The Indian Ocean archipelago of the Comoros had already said Friday it would not accept migrants expelled from the neighboring French island of Mayotte.

title: In Brussels, lobbies have a bright future ahead
description: A recent book on European lobbying explains how, due to a lack of financial and human resources, the Commission calls on the expertise of interest groups at all levels of lawmaking.

title: American conservatives mount offensive against transgender people
description: Twenty states prohibit transgender women from participating in sports, and beyond that, laws restricting transgender people's rights are proliferating across the country.

title: War in Ukraine: The elite hackers fighting against Russian cyber attacks
description: To counter Russian cyberattacks, the Ukrainian military staff has called on hackers with deep knowledge of their digital adversaries.

title: Sudan: Chaotic evacuations for diplomats, foreign nationals as deadly war enters second week
description: A French person was injured during Sunday's evacuation operation in Khartoum organized by Paris. With over 70% of hospitals no longer able to operate, and amidst electricity and water supply problems, many Sudanese are also fleeing.

title: Fears over Hollywood shutdown as writers strike looms
description: If Hollywood's producers and companies do not grant writers better pay conditions by May 1, writers will put down their pens and close their laptops to go on strike. In 2007-2008, the industry was paralyzed for three months.

title: How France's intellectual left fell out of love with Macron
description: The authoritarian management of the pension reform has ended up disenchanting many left-wing thinkers who supported Macron when he first ran for president in 2017.

title: Climate activists stop traffic in Berlin to highlight German government's inactivity
description: Protesters glued themselves to the street surface to highlight 'that the government has no plan to stop the destruction of the basis of our existence'

title: Global military spending reaches all-time high of €2.04 trillion in 2022
description: Key factors for the significant rise in military spending in 2022 are the war in Ukraine and heightened tensions in East Asia.

title: Chinese ambassador's remarks on Crimea provoke outrage in Europe
description: Beijing's ambassador to Paris suggested countries that emerged after the fall of the Soviet Union 'don't have effective status under international law because there is not an international agreement confirming their status as sovereign nations.'

title: In Rio, a zipline to the Sugarloaf causes controversy
description: The attraction, which is deemed to be 'sustainable,' is dividing the Cariocas. Construction work has been interrupted for further analysis.

title: In Niger, Orano's giant uranium mine faces multiple threats
description: Dealing with the risk of terrorism, pollution and local protests, the company is exploiting a vast deposit of the precious ore destined for French nuclear power plants.

title: Burkina Faso: 60 civilians killed by men wearing military uniforms
description: According to witnesses, survivors said more than 100 people on motorbikes and pick-up trucks raided the village of Karma where dozens of men and young people were killed by the men dressed in military uniforms.

title: Office slang: 'Greenhushing,' the silent opposite of 'greenwashing'
description: Out of fear of backlash for not implementing responsible environmental measures, a company may be tempted not to communicate about them. It's the exact opposite of 'greenwashing.'

title: Nagorno-Karabakh: Azerbaijan sets up checkpoint on key route to Armenia
description: A French foreign ministry statement said it 'deplores' the development as a violation of the ceasefire agreements that would hamper the negotiations process.

title: In Argentina, exorbitant clothing prices amidst historic inflation
description: In March, clothing and shoe prices had risen 119% year-on-year. The population is finding innovative strategies for dressing.
